NZIQN Part B Practice Questions (Chapter-wise)

Nursing Fundamentals

1. A patient with asthma is using a nebulizer. Which of the following should the nurse monitor? (Variant 1)
Blood glucose levels
Respiratory rate and effort
Body temperature
Electrolyte levels
2. What is the first priority when a patient is found unresponsive with no pulse? (Variant 2)
Start CPR
Call for help
Check for breathing
Administer oxygen
3. A patient with asthma is using a nebulizer. Which of the following should the nurse monitor? (Variant 3)
Blood glucose levels
Respiratory rate and effort
Body temperature
Electrolyte levels
4. Which action is appropriate for a nurse to take when a patient is in the early stages of shock? (Variant 4)
Administer IV fluids to restore blood volume
Provide high-dose oxygen
Start the patient on a sedative
Monitor vital signs and reassess regularly
5. A patient with asthma is using a nebulizer. Which of the following should the nurse monitor? (Variant 5)
Blood glucose levels
Respiratory rate and effort
Body temperature
Electrolyte levels
6. What is the primary purpose of a nursing care plan? (Variant 6)
To outline the patient's medications
To provide a framework for patient care
To monitor a patient's vital signs
To document physician orders
7. Which of the following is a common sign of hypovolemic shock? (Variant 7)
Hypertension
